Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmmoBox, Blood, Exit, PathfindingEnemy, Player, RandomEnemy, Spawn, Wall

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    An entity within the maze
    Author:
    Yujin, Luke, Steele, Michael

      • setMap

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        A well behaved entity would draw itself scaled into the graphics' clip rectangle.
        Parameters:
        g -

      • ontick

        public final void ontick()
        A well behaved entity would change it's next location AND NOT IT'S CURRENT LOCATION when updating its tick. This lets the collision engine resolve properly.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Do not call this method directly. Use ontick() instead, which will also take into account direction of entity, sanitizing nextlocation and updating previouslocation.

      • getCurrentLocation

        public Coord getCurrentLocation()

      • getType

        public EntityType getType()

      • shouldBumpInto

        public boolean shouldBumpInto(Entity other)
        If we collide with this entity, should we physically collide?
        Returns:
        whether the objects should collide

      • collide

        public void collide(Entity other)
        This function is called AFTER the necessary blocking mechanisms have been done by the engine. Every object that occupies our square/was trying to occupy our square/occupies the square we tried to go to/occupies the square we tried to occupy will be on this list, even if we don't share a collision layer. The collision layer is for "blocking" effect only, which is dealt automatically in the engine. Hence, it is possible to have entities on this list who share no layers in common and have the same coordinates as us.
        Parameters:
        other - the other Entity
